result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn Allen Scott

defendant.name: Scott, Glenn Allen
defendant.address: 5412 West Blue Mound Road, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Glenn Allen Scott.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case is calendared for plea and sentencing. Defense is requesting an adjournment. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in court in person with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appeared by video.  Mallory Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in court, appear in person with attorney Lori Kuehn, appear by video .  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  State witness present. Attorney Kuehn needs more time to meet with client. Attorney Kuehn appear by video. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Indigency Hearing. Indigency Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Lori Kuehn, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning at July 1, 2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in court, appears without counsel. Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Indigency hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Glenn Allen Scott in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Glenn Allen Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
